decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly get powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Lotus Petal. These creatures can provide a game-winning advantage, overwhelming opponents and securing victory. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect your combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is designed to facilitate casting these powerful spells quickly and efficiently. Overall, the key strategy is to cheat big creatures into play and win the game quickly.

This deck focuses on generating massive amounts of mana through rituals, diamonds, and Lotus Petals in order to cast multiple spells in a single turn to create a storm count. By drawing through the deck with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to find combo pieces like Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam to win the game in a single, explosive turn. The deck also includes disruption cards like Duress and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own combo.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. The deck aims to control the game by using efficient spells like Force of Will and Brainstorm to stay ahead of the opponent. Young Pyromancer and Gurmag Angler provide threats on the board while cards like Cabal Therapy and Kolaghan's Command help to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through careful resource management and control of the game state.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game with powerful removal spells, counterspells, and disruptive hand disruption while also deploying threats like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic to pressure the opponent. The deck aims to stabilize the board with cards like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull, while also generating card advantage with cards like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements, with utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Ultimately, this deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a grindy game.

The main concept of this control deck is to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play early using cards like Shallow Grave and Goryo's Vengeance. The deck also utilizes reanimation spells like Reanimate and Entomb to further enable this game plan. The deck runs disruption in the form of Thoughtseize, Cabal Therapy, and Gitaxian Probe to control the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw and selection with Brainstorm and Ponder to consistently find its combo pieces and disruption.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and countermagic while generating card advantage through efficient card draw and card recursion. The deck aims to control the board with efficient threats like Baleful Strix and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet, while utilizing planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope to generate additional advantage. With a well-timed mix of disruption and threats, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a victory.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo - Show and Tell deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal, and then use Show and Tell to cheat in powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. By utilizing Omniscience, players can cast these high-cost creatures for free, putting immense pressure on opponents. The deck also includes disruption like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo and control the game. Sneak Attack provides an alternate win condition if Show and Tell is not available.

This Grixis Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of powerful removal spells, hand disruption, and counterspells while generating card advantage with cards like Baleful Strix and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to control the game and ultimately outvalue the opponent. By controlling the board and resources, this deck seeks to grind out incremental advantages over time and win the game through attrition.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells, discard spells, and removal while generating card advantage with cards like Baleful Strix, Snapcaster Mage, and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. The deck aims to control the board while setting up for powerful late-game plays with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Kolaghan's Command. Deathrite Shaman provides additional utility by disrupting graveyard strategies and providing mana acceleration. The deck prioritizes efficient removal and disruption to outvalue the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of disruption spells, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while maintaining card advantage with Baleful Strix and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It also has access to removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Kolaghan's Command to deal with threats. The deck utilizes powerful spells like Force of Will to protect its own game plan and close out games with efficient threats like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures and efficient spells to control the battlefield and pressure the opponent quickly. It combines strong early game threats like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer with disruptive spells like Stifle and Force of Will to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes powerful cards like True-Name Nemesis and Gurmag Angler to close out games quickly. The mana base is tailored to support the deck's color requirements and also disrupt the opponent's mana base with Wasteland.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy and efficiency of Elves to generate mana quickly and efficiently, allowing for explosive combo plays. The deck focuses on cards that can generate card advantage, such as Glimpse of Nature and Elvish Visionary, while also including key combo pieces like Heritage Druid and Nettle Sentinel. With access to powerful win conditions like Craterhoof Behemoth and Nissa, Vital Force, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of speed and resilience. Crop Rotation and Natural Order provide additional utility and flexibility for finding crucial pieces for the combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive Eldrazi creatures with disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst to control the game and overwhelm the opponent. It also includes mana acceleration like Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide to cast larger threats ahead of schedule. The inclusion of Wasteland helps disrupt the opponent's mana base while cards like Thought-Knot Seer provide additional disruption and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to quickly deploy powerful threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

The deck focuses on recurring value loops using cards like Life from the Loam, Knight of the Reliquary, and Punishing Fire to control the board while generating card advantage. It also utilizes hate cards like Chalice of the Void and Gaddock Teeg to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to grind out the opponent by utilizing its lands for multiple purposes, such as mana acceleration, removal, and graveyard recursion. Liliana of the Veil helps disrupt opponents' hands and the overall game plan revolves around resource denial and efficient threat assessment.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent early with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and Young Pyromancer, while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also utilizes cards like Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt to deal with opposing threats while maintaining tempo advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy and Deathrite Shaman helps to disrupt the opponent's hand and graveyard, making it difficult for them to stabilize and mount a defense.

The deck focuses on locking down opponents with cards like Blood Moon, Trinisphere, and Ensnaring Bridge, while also using aggressive creatures like Magus of the Moon and Chandra to apply pressure. The mana base is designed to support these cards while also enabling fast starts with cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide. The goal is to disrupt opponents' mana bases and prevent them from casting their spells, while also quickly closing out the game with powerful planeswalkers and creatures.
